Prachi Solanki, Buyer

166 Brock Street

Kingston, Ontario

K7L 5G2

Prachi.solanki@KingstonHSC.ca

613-544-3400 ext 3039

 

-------------------------------

From: Garrett, Nancy <Nancy.Garrett@kingstonhsc.ca>
Sent: Thursday, May 15, 2025 12:39 PM
To: Wilkinson, Amanda <Amanda.Wilkinson@kingstonhsc.ca>
Cc: French, Ron <ron.french@KingstonHSC.ca>; KHSC Purchasing <purchasing@kingstonhsc.ca>
Subject: Work Order:231278

 

Hi Amanda,

 

I had Ron in my office with reference to this work order request.  The sit/stand requires a new motor. My question to you is how old is this desk, is it a possible warranty?  Perhaps Purchasing will be able to source a new motor and actually find out if it is warranty.  I have attached two pictures to help them locate either the PO or warranty information.  If they {Purchasing} cannot deem warranty, they will be able to source the motor for you, but your manager will have to provide a req with the Cost Centre.  Once you have the parts that you require, you can then re-submit a request for installation.

 

Please advise once you have spoken to Purchasing.

 

Ty

 

 

Nancy Garrett

Maintenance Coordinator

Kingston Health Sciences Centre

Kingston General Hospital Site

76 Stuart Street

Kingston On

K7L 2V7

tickets.subject: Replacement part for sit-stand desk? / My replacement Co # is S200780489
tickets.raw_subject: Replacement part for sit-stand desk? / My replacement Co # is S200780489
tickets.description:
Good morning, Bush Business Furniture,

In 2022, NOAA Fisheries (Alaska Fisheries Science Center) purchased a number of your sit-stand desks from GSA Advantage. Here is a link  (https://www.gsaadvantage.gov/advantage/ws/catalog/product_detail?gsin=11000053394578) for one of the wood/leg combinations. One of the desks my group received has developed a bad "Control System" - we have tried resetting the desk, but it won't go to, and remain at, the desired height. We're a technical group, so evaluating all parts - and swapping out the Control System fixed the problem. I've attached a snap of the part sticker.

Is it possible to get a replacement part sent to us? 

Very best,
Sandy




--

Sandra Parker-Stetter

Program Manager - Midwater Assessment & Conservation Engineering

RACE Division, Alaska Fisheries Science Center

NOAA Fisheries | U.S. Department of Commerce

Office: (206) 526-6435

www.fisheries.noaa.gov

tickets.subject: Request for Compensation Due to Incorrect Door Parts Shipped with Murphy Bed Order
tickets.raw_subject: Request for Compensation Due to Incorrect Door Parts Shipped with Murphy Bed Order
tickets.description:
Dear Bestar Customer Service,

I am writing to express my deep frustration and disappointment regarding a recent experience with my Pur Murphy bed order (Order # 19344).

After receiving and inventorying the shipment, I hired a professional to assist with the assembly because I have a bad back and cannot carry the heavy shipment to the second floor, or assemble myself.

The whole moving and assembling process took us approximately 9 hours and $630. Unfortunately, after carefully assembling the unit and installing the two opening doors, we discovered that the doors provided were incompatible with the bed frame. It was only after I proactively contacted your team that I was informed newer, updated parts existedparts that should have been shipped to me from the start, but were not.

This error has resulted in significant disruption, cost, and inconvenience, and I ended up paying an additional $200 based on the following:

  I paid to have the incorrect doors installed, only to have them uninstalled once we realized they were the wrong parts.
  I then incurred additional labor costs for reinstalling the correct doors once they arrived.
  My assembler also had to spend additional time transporting the old, heavy doors from the second floor to the ground level, and then carrying the replacement doors back upstairs for installation.

This situation could have been entirely avoided had the correct parts been shipped in the first place. Moreover, I find it unacceptable that I had to reach out to your team to identify the issue, rather than being notified proactively.

Given the financial and logistical burden caused entirely by this oversight on Bestars part, I am requesting fair compensation for the added costs and inconvenience. At a minimum, this should cover the duplicate labor charges and additional transportation costs caused by the incorrect shipment.

Please let me know how you plan to resolve this.

Sincerely,

Derek Mathieson
954-872-9345

tickets.subject: Re: Ticket 186360 is waiting for your response: Ordered wrong file cabinet
tickets.raw_subject: Re: Ticket 186360 is waiting for your response: Ordered wrong file cabinet
tickets.description:
This is a follow-up to your previous request #186360 "Ordered wrong file cabinet"

Dear Support Staff :

I am writing to address the issue of our filing cabinet.  It has been a long time, but my husband and I have been traveling extensively and it is only now that we are back at home and completing our projects.

I will begin with the information you requested:

1. Name on the order : 
Mary Frank
2. The original address to which the order shippedAnd the address youd like the part(s) sent to if they differ

7386 W Paraiso Dr

Glendale Arizona 85310

United States

3. The number beginning with A1 or A2 listed on the front cover of the assembly booklet
A176308H
4. The stamped-on lot code located on either the front or the back of the assembly booklettypically in blue or black ink
71503422
5. A phone number we can add to the order should we have any questions
1 (623) 418-9592
6. The letter associated with the damaged/missing part(s) that can be found in the instruction booklet on the page with the exploded view--or if it still has the sticker--the full part number beginning with a W or S for a wood piece or an H for a piece of hardware.
The unit came fully assembled.  My husband recounts that the back and side of the cabinet was damaged when we received it. I was mistaken when I thought the drawer issue started after we moved the cabinet. 
For this reason, I cannot give a specific part, and there is literally no way for us to replace a part as the entire main box is out of square.  The top drawer, which was impeded and sticking, is unusable with anything of weight in the drawer.
7. The Bush Industries Model #--this is typically printed on the cardboard box in which you received the unit.
We did not keep the box.  The only identifying numbers I have are above.  It is a Series C Lateral File Cabinet, Mocha Cherry.

What do  you propose as a solution? 
We look forward to your response.
Regards,
Mary Frank

Hello,

Were reaching out with an important update to ensure your new Bestar Murphy Bed works exactly as it should.

Whats Going On?Due to a recent design change, some beds may have been shipped with a mechanism that isnt compatible.This might stop you from fully closing the wall bed doors.

The Good News: Theres no safety concern.Were here to help you check if you have the right parts and get you set up perfectly.

How You Can Check: If youve already assembled the bed and the front doors close without any trouble, youre all set!No further action is needed.

If you haven't assembled the bed yet, weve attached two photos for you to compare.Photo 1 shows the incompatible mechanism, while Photo 2 shows the correct one.

If you discover you have the incompatible part, or if youre not sure, please let us know right away.We'll send you the proper parts or instructions quickly, depending on your model number, and will guide you through any adjustments.Please send an email to bestarsupport@esolutionsfurniture.com (mailto:bestarsupport@esolutionsfurniture.com%20) with the following information:

Indicate the model number of the Murphy Bed you have purchased. You can find this on the top right-hand corner of the assembly guide or on your order confirmation.
Include your name, shipping address, and phone number.

If you prefer to call us, we will be delighted to assist you.You can reach our Customer Support team at 1-888-823-7827.

Thank you for your patience and for being a valued customer.

Warm Regards,

Bestar Customer Support

tickets.description:
Numro de commande : 32396

J'ai achet 3 bibliothques Bibliothque  5 tablettes (165700-110140).

Je suis extrmement du du produit! Les "Quick connect" ne se vissent pas dans les panneaux et le "wood dowel" n'ont aucunes adhrences mme en essayant de les enfoncer avec un marteau. Lorsque ma conjointe a tlphon, elle s'est fait dire qu'elle ne visait pas assez fort.... Bref, pour tre en mesure de monter le tout, nous avons du coller toutes les pices pour avoir de l'adhrence vue le problme de qualit gnraliser du produit. De plus, la pluspart des KD Cam sortent des pices une fois vises.

Pire encore, nous venons d'ouvrir la troisime boite et le contenu est endommag. La premire pice, qui correspond au fond de la bibliothque, est dfonc.

Quelles sont les compensations dans de telles situations?

Merci de nous avoir contacts et davoir demand une recommandation pour un fournisseur de services dassemblage de meubles. Malheureusement, nous navons pas de liste de fournisseurs de services dans votre rgion offrir. Si vous avez besoin daide pour ce service, nous vous recommandons deffectuer une recherche sur Internet pour trouver un fournisseur appropri. Le paiement du service sera convenu directement entre vous et le fournisseur de services choisi.


Nous vous recommandons fortement de faire des recherches et des vrifications avant de choisir un fournisseur de services pour vous assurer quil rpond vos besoins et vos attentes spcifiques.


Voici quelques conseils prendre en compte lors de la slection dun fournisseur de services dassemblage de meubles :


  1. Vrifier les avis : Consultez les avis et les valuations en ligne des fournisseurs de services que vous envisagez dengager. Cela peut vous donner une ide de leur rputation et de la qualit de leur travail.
  2. Demander des recommandations : Si possible, demandez des amis, la famille ou des collgues sils ont des recommandations pour des assembleurs de meubles fiables.
  3. Demander des devis : Contactez les fournisseurs de services de votre liste et demandez des devis ou des estimations pour le travail dassemblage dont vous avez besoin. Cela vous aidera comparer les prix.
  4. Assurance et licences : Assurez-vous que le fournisseur de services a lassurance ncessaire et les licences requises pour oprer dans votre rgion.
  5. Exprience : Renseignez-vous sur lexprience et lexpertise des assembleurs. Certains travaux dassemblage peuvent ncessiter des connaissances spcialises.
  6. Disponibilit : Vrifiez sils sont disponibles lorsque vous avez besoin du service et sils peuvent rpondre aux exigences de votre horaire.
  7. Communication : Une communication claire est essentielle. Assurez-vous de pouvoir contacter facilement le fournisseur de services pour discuter de vos besoins et de toutes proccupations.
  8. Contrat ou accord : Une fois que vous avez choisi un fournisseur, il est judicieux davoir un accord ou un contrat crit qui prcise la porte des travaux, le cot et tout autre terme important.


En suivant ces tapes, vous augmentez la probabilit de trouver un fournisseur de services dassemblage de meubles fiable et comptent qui rpond vos besoins et vos attentes. Bonne chance pour votre projet dassemblage de meubles!

  • Insurance and Licensing: Ensure that the service provider has the necessary insurance and any required licenses to operate in your area.
  • Experience: Inquire about the experience and expertise of the assemblers. Some assembly jobs may require specialized knowledge.
  • Availability: Check if they are available when you need the service, and if they can meet your scheduling requirements.
  • Communication: Clear communication is essential. Make sure you can easily contact the service provider to discuss your needs and any concerns.
  • Contract or Agreement: Once you've chosen a provider, it's a good idea to have a written agreement or contract that outlines the scope of work, cost, and any other important terms.


By taking these steps, you can increase the likelihood of finding a reliable and skilled furniture assembly service provider that meets your needs and expectations. Good luck with your furniture assembly project!

The Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) Title VI consumer message is a requirement under the TSCA Title VI regulations for composite wood products. These messages are intended to inform consumers about the formaldehyde emissions levels in the composite wood products they purchase and use, helping them make informed choices to protect their health.


Our products are manufactured with composite wood. Under TSCA Title VI, composite wood products that contain formaldehyde emissions above a certain threshold are required to carry a cancer warning label. The labels and messages provide assurance to consumers that the composite wood products they are purchasing meet the required standards for formaldehyde emissions, which is an important factor in ensuring indoor air quality and reducing potential health risks associated with formaldehyde exposure.

macros.title: STURDY Act
macros.description: An explanation of this law and its purpose

actions.value:
The STURDY Act, also known as the Stop Tip-overs of Unstable, Risky Dressers on Youth Act, is a crucial piece of legislation aimed at enhancing the safety of dressers, chests, and other bedroom furniture to reduce the risk of tip-overs, particularly for children. In compliance with this act, manufacturers are required to meet specific safety standards outlined in regulations such as 16 CFR 1262 and ASTM 2057-23.

To ensure our products meet these rigorous safety standards and prioritize the well-being of our customers, we have made design adjustments, including potentially reducing the size of drawers. These modifications are intended to enhance stability and minimize the risk of tip-overs, ultimately providing a safer environment.

We understand that changes in product design may impact your experience, and we apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. If you have any further questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us. Your satisfaction and safety are our top priorities.

Thank you for your understanding and continued support.

The STURDY Act, also known as the Stop Tip-overs of Unstable, Risky Dressers on Youth Act, is a crucial piece of legislation aimed at enhancing the safety of dressers, chests, and other bedroom furniture to reduce the risk of tip-overs, particularly for children. In compliance with this act, manufacturers are required to meet specific safety standards outlined in regulations such as 16 CFR 1262 and ASTM 2057-23.

To ensure our products meet these rigorous safety standards and prioritize the well-being of our customers, we have made design adjustments, including potentially reducing the size of drawers. These modifications are intended to enhance stability and minimize the risk of tip-overs, ultimately providing a safer environment.

We understand that changes in product design may impact your experience, and we apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. If you have any further questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us. Your satisfaction and safety are our top priorities.

Thank you for your understanding and continued support.
This ticket was escalated and move to high priority

Thank you for reaching out. Please note that Account Name is responsible for the shipment and delivery of our products. As manufacturers, Bestar/Bush Furniture are not involved in the shipping process, which means we do not have direct control over the shipment. We understand this can be frustrating and sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused.

If youve already contacted "Account Name" customer service and havent received a satisfactory response, we recommend escalating the issue to the management level. Supervisors often have more access or knowledge regarding the contracted responsibilities and may be able to help you resolve the situation more effectively.

We truly appreciate your understanding. Please dont hesitate to reach out if theres anything else we can assist you with, whether it's addressing other concerns or offering guidance with the assembly of our product. Our team is committed to supporting you in any way we can.

macros.title: Wall Bed Incident::Advising of Recall and Sending Repair Kit

actions.value:
Good Morning/Afternoon:

 

 

Thank you for reaching out. 
 

 

We require some information to be able to proceed. Once this has been furnished, we suggest finding a qualified installer to inspect and install the repair kit we will send you. The repair kit is free of charge, and if you can furnish a paid invoice from a competent installer and you are the original purchaser of the product, we will reimburse the cost of the installation within the parameters outlined in the letter. 
 

 

1. Original Order Number
 

2. Point of purchase of wall bed (Costco, Bestar, Amazon, etc). 
 

3. Name on Original Order
 

4. Address to which the original order shipped and the address at which you would like the repair kit shipped if they differ
 

 

 

Once received and installed, please be advised that the invoice from the installer will need to include the following to be eligible for reimbursement. 

 

1. Consumers name, address & phone number where work was done
2. It must indicate business by name
3. It must list business address
4. It must list business phone number
5. It must itemize the work done.
6. No reimbursements for estimates.
7. Work should indicate inspection or reinstallation if necessary to wall structure.
8. Invoice should indicate Paid.

 

 

Thank you,

 

**********************

Une fois le lit reu et install, veuillez noter que la facture de l'installateur devra inclure les lments suivants pour tre ligible au remboursement.

 

1. Le nom, l'adresse et le numro de tlphone du consommateur o les travaux ont t effectus.

Thank you for reaching out to {{ticket.brand.name}} regarding the CPSC press release dated Novmenber 18, 2024. Recently, the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) brought to our attention an oversight related to the timely reporting of an incident that occurred several years ago. Bestar is addressing this matter openly, including paying a fine to resolve it. This resolution reflects our current leaderships commitment to accountability, continuous improvement, and the highest safety standards. We take pride in the manufacturing and safety of our wall beds. They are manufactured and tested in accordance with the ISO 10131 testing standard. Our installation mechanisms differ from others in the market, and we have always focused on innovation and to reduce risks related to the use of or products. Consumer Safety is our top priority.
